article_title: EU Rejects Dutch Plea to Review Cable Merger
article_text:
BRUSSELS—The European Union's antitrust agency Wednesday rejected a Dutch regulator's plea to be allowed to review Liberty Global's planned €6.9 billion ($9.5 billion) acquisition of Dutch cable operator Ziggo, opting to retain control over a key merger in Europe's fast-consolidating telecoms sector.

The deal, if approved, would give John Malone's international cable company access to 90% of Dutch households due to its ownership of...
